Dabble

Writing

I write occasionally (less frequently these days than I would care to admit) at SeePha. This started off many years ago on blogger as an arbit collection of personal posts and at the most chuckle-inducing rants but seems to have grown older and wiser over the years into a longer form comprising quite a few travelogues. Travelling has been a deeply personal and favourite pastime.

The other side to storytelling comes in the form of photography, another evolving and satisfying hobby.

Music

2001: I hate going to violin classes, mum. I want a keyboard. I like that thing.
2002: I love this keyboard. If only I had my own.
2007: The drums is where it’s at. This is so intuitive. And the most satisfying thing to play.
…
2014: Oh look, a violin! I wonder if I can still play it like old.
2015: I love the violin. Man I know nothing about wind instruments. Also, the Irish whistle sounds beautiful.
2016: I absolutely love the damn whistle. Oh look, the bansuri is played with the same finger-placement!
